reviews.sentence: Needs renovation to stay competitive. This glorious boutique property clearly had it prime. Great location in downtown Cincinnati near most attractions. Elegant common areas and grand marble staircase that I loved walking. Yes the charm is indeed that the marble is slightly worn. Attentive staff clean and nice amenities like plush towels and high end soaps. Valet and doormen who get the car door for you seem to always be there. Wonderful and 5star. Unfortunately the spacious clean room was old. Like 1970s old. And worn. Hvac worked sluggishly decor was stained and torn and the bathroom was one of the worst I have seen at this price point. The stained slippery oversized tub with no safety grips is a lawsuit waiting to happen. Faucets do not work well sinks are stained chipped cracked and the toilet barely manages its job if you can crouch so low to the ground to get to it. Strong water pressure in the shower does not make up for the torn curtains and lack of temperature control. Upon arrival I requested a renovated room. This would have helped. Although the hotel was no where near capacity the request was denied unles I wished to pay 150 per night. I paid 125 and took a daily risk in that bathroom. For even less per night other downtown properties including the newly built ones next door are likely safer. I wanted to love the Cincinatian and were I in a renovated room I likely would have. Instead I can not recommend this property.

A Very Pleasant Hotel. All of the staff were welcoming and helpful. Our room was clean and very pleasant. We were told it was one of the newly renovated rooms. The hotel was also kept very clean. The last time the lobby was renovated was probably in the early 1990s but it is welcoming. Maybe soon it will be updated also. Our experience was lovely. We enjoyed the sitting area near the bar to talk with family and an old friend. The location was extremely convenient to the new huge park that everyone must see. Great time.
Exceptional. Renovated rooms with old charm.

Renovated deluxe rooms are AMAZING. Standard rooms are disgusting. We stayed in a renovated deluxe King room New Years week. The room was plush comfortable and very nicely appointed. Definitely a 4. We returned after New Years and got a standard room which was hotel selected room via Priceline. The room was old disgusting there were cracks in the tub white stains on the couch and the bed was hard which caused our backs to ache. Standard rooms are a 2 NOT a 4.

Will continue to stay here. I have been going to Cincinnati for years now and it is still my first choice. it is old but well maintained. The rooms are renovated and the staff is ALWAYS friendly and accommodating. This trip Corey did a great job.

Suitable for Brief Business Stay. Nice clean hotel. Not over the top fancy but a little nicer than your bland chains. Room had a charming mix of updated bedding and amenities with older classic lounge chair ottoman and bedroom bench type furniture. King room was spacious with an enormous 2 room bathroom. People walking around upstairs sounded like elephants could be due to being an older building but it was extremely loud. Late afternoon and morning staff were very friendly mid day staff not so much. Beautiful lobby and lounge area. could not help but notice more shabby mismatched not in a good way furniture outside each floors elevators quite odd. Restaurant and bar onsite. Excellent central business district location. Kitty corner from Fountain Square. Walking distance to several restaurants and attractions.
classic hotel. One of the best options in Cincinnati. Great old hotel totally renovated. The only issue is that the fitness center should also be renovated. Nice bar great breakfast.

Historical hotel with nice updates. Historical hotel with the ware on the marble stairs to prove it. rooms very well updated and spacious but hall carpet on 8th floor has obvious signs of water damage and could use a remodel that is unles they are trying to keep it as original as possible.

Spacious comfortable rooms in a historic hotel at a reasonable price. it is a beautifully renovated historic hotel in the middle of the city. It was an easy walk to see Phantom at the theater up the street. Comfortable and spacious room. I think the cost of the valet parking is a bit steep. there is probably other cheaper parking alternatives but since we are unfamiliar with the city we did not know what those were.

One of Cincys Finest. We stay here when we visit the casino. it is close to everything downtown. Small but great hang out bar before the games. Excellent food. Old hotel with modern updates. This is definitely one of best hotels in the Ohio Valley area.

On its was to be a jewel downtown. First if you fly Ultimate Air they have a drop off and pick up here in the lobby. This historic hotel 182 is having a 2018 makeover. The redone rooms are super cool and huge. Bamboo hardwood floors plenty of natural light and listed in the historic hotels of America book. I am excited for the lobby renovation. it is convient to the convention center UC fountain sq and all the sports areas. Check out the pictures of how nice the new rooms are. Give this place a shot.
One of the worst hotels. Hard to locate Have us a full bed Vs kingWhen moving us less quality room but bigger bed. Carpet awful. Whole place needs repair. One of the worse hotels that I️ have stayed.

Too expensive for what you get. Went here for our anniversary. When we pulled up there was no valet or concierge. After coming back twice I called the hotel. They said just park and come in and someone will come and park the car. Never heard of such a thing. Check in was uneventful hotel is smaller than expected and very outdated. I felt AAA 4 star ratings are definitely slipping. Jacuzi room was nice but not updated with the conveniences listed in the website. Obviously not renovated yet. Booked this hotel because it was on sale but the fact that they were doing renovations and nickle and dime you for everything still did not make it a good value. My advice. Go with a chain whose quality you trust.
It looks like a pretty cool hotel but they are under renovation. As of today the fitness center is part of the renovation. Staff is friendly and nice.

will not stay here again. The hotel was undergoing major renovation so there was no restaurant or bar. This was no mentioned in the listing. The discounted room we stayed in 815 was small and furnished with goods that looked like they came from Goodwill. One of the lamps quit working on our last night. There was not one piece of artwork in the room anywhere. And the bed was the worst bed we have ever slept on including bed at cheap hotels. Our backs hurt so bad we could hardly stand up in the morning. The bathroom however was very nice. Very worn and needed updating but it was nice to have a large bathroom with two sinks. There was no make up mirror which made it almost impossible to get ready in the morning. Every other hotel we have stayed at in the last year has some kind of a magnifying mirror in the bathroom. Including the hotel we were at in Cincinnati the night before. my husband and I have stayed at the Cincinnati in various times over the years and this was not at all the same hotel that we remember. I am sure once the renovations are complete it will be beautiful however I am not sure that they will update their discounted quote rooms which is a shame. The room that we stayed in was more like a Motel 6 instead of the picture that you showed on the booking site for a deluxe queen room.

This is a tough review. We tried so hard to go with the flow and be flexible mistakes happen. We drove up from Nashville to partake in Reds opening days activities. We booked through Hotwire. We checked in and received our room key. The staff was kind and enjoyable. As we made our way to the 5th floor and to the room the door was blocked by something. It scared us first as we thought we accidentally just went into someone ’s room but as we looked it was scaffolding fromthe present remodeling that is happening. Remodeling by the way was not disclosed to us. We got a new room on the 7th floor. Super nice clean had a balcony that opened to the interior of the hotel that door was also unable to open fully because of scaffolding. They are remodeling the entire interior court yard of this hotel. We did n’t think much of it until we were awoken by hammering yelling pipes banging. A construction crew showed up and now had the whole hotel sounding like an echo chamber. We moved rooms yet again and had better experiences. We ate lunch and walked back to relax and could n’t because the fire alarm was going of on our floor in our room. So needless to say this experience has been anything but relaxing. Hopefully they comp some folks after the remodeling is done.

Wow Pretty Bare. So my husband and I stayed for three nights for a conference at a nearby hotel. We were notified 24hrs before our arrival that there were renovations going on. I actually first knew about the renovations from prior reviews. I did n’t mind if one part of the building was going to closed off. I just did n’t know 90 of the building was going to be off limits. That includes the bar the restaurant and the gym. When we first walked it was no bigger than an average bedroom just two elevators and a tiny front desk. Wow. We stayed on the 7th floor. I liked the hardwood floors and the layout of the bathroom. But we found most of our time hanging out at other hotels. There is no vending machine or room service. On Expedia it mentions they have a shuttle which is a lie. For as much as we paid my husband and I should of just stayed at the Hyat. They should of offered people discounts since everything is closed. Or at least inform there visitors exactly what “ renovations ” are occurring and what amenities are affected. The staff was rather uninviting as well.
Very nice hotel. At the time of this review they are in the middle of renovations. did not hear a peep from construction. My girlfriend and I enjoyed our stay.

One of the better hotels in downtown Cincy will be great once renovations are complete. Spacious room very nice room. Clean for the most part. Nice amenities in the room. Pillows and bed were very uncomfortable bed was n’t very stable made a lot of noise even if you sat on it let alone move while you were laying down. Hotel was under renovation which was not advertised and I paid 300 for one night for a hotel that did n’t have a restaurant and barely had a lobby and had scaffolding set up all over. Staff was nice and valet guys were excellent.

Bats bathroom faucets and a warped floor. The recently renovated Cincinatian hotel is a bust. My recent stay included Bats flying down the hallway a door to my room that you had to put your shoulder to to open it far enough to enter and a faucet in the bath hanging in the sink. Best of all the staff was so scripted but unwilling to do anything even move me to another room. Maintenance was on the way for 2 days but they were a no show so was the management apparently the do n’t work at night.

Older facility that is been restored as almost all Curio Collection properties are. Staff was very accommodating and pleasant. Rooms were oddly shaped with tiny windows but clean and updated. Would NOT recommend for a family with children as the old building has open stairwell railings that are extremely low and could present extreme danger for small childrenand any adult not paying attention for that matter.

Below standard food and beverage and lacking attention to the details. This should be a good 4star boutique hotel. Instead you have a bland hotel with below standard food and beverage options and a complete lack of attention to the details. The hotel was so bland. If you did not know better you could have been in a forgettable airport hotel. There was not even background music in the lobby elevator or public spaces. At check in I was not addressed by name nor was I thanked for staying. All of the staff were polite. They were not intentionally bad. it is just that they were not well trained in the sort of service one expects at 4star hotel. Very rough around the edges. Nothing refined. No bellman to assist with luggage although the valet parking attendant did at least help me with getting my bag out of the trunk. I also never saw a manager. No complimentary newspapers. No umbrellas. My room had a bathrobe but no slippers. Speaking of room the TV was great as was the wireless internet. But the floor is wood or fake wood which makes a lot of noise especially with luggage on wheels. The bathroom is awkward as there is one sink in the room with the toilet and another bigger sink in the main room of the bathroom. Weird. Instead of a modern luxury shower the hotel has old Jacuzi tubs which I found difficult to get out of when I was wet. I was really afraid of falling. Also the bathroom showed a considerable amount of wear and tear despite this being a recently renovated property see picture. My bed was comfortable but the pillows were horrible. The pillows were four twin sized pillows for a king sized bed. They were either polyester fill or lumpy polyester foam. Horrible especially since Hilton normally has luxury feather king sized pillows. There were two major design flaws in the room First the door does not close all the way. As a result it lets in a lot of light. Look at the pictures. One picture shows the gap between the door and the door frame when the door is closed. The other picture shows how the door gap is eliminated when you push the door closed and hold it in position. The second design flaw is in the bathroom. The towel racks sits right under the dirt old heating and air conditioning vent which means dust and other things are likely falling down on the towels. Not exactly what you want. The breakfast restaurant is horrible. When I was there they were out of pretty much everything except bacon eggs and muffins. there is no on site lunch option nor is there a restaurant unles you consider the bar pub only opens after 4 pm a restaurant. The owners missed a huge chance for a marquee restaurant. All things considered I would not stay here again. You can do much better including at the nearby Westin and Hilton hotels.

No heat. Warning no heat in this hotel. For a newly renovated property one would think they would have this type of issue. Gym was quite small as well. Machines were new but pretty dirty already. I ’l be back at Hampton next door on my next trip. ☹ ️.

This is a lovely historic hotel that was recently bought and renovated by Hilton. The hotel seems to have lost some character in the renovation. Our room was very nice but there was a huge gap under the door which allowed in a lot of light and noise. The temperature controls also did n’t seem to work and our room was a balmy 78. The hotel bar was nice and the staff was super attentive and friendly. A solid choice. but with so many great hotels in Cincy we ’l likely try another next time based on this experience.

Good but not great. Nice hotel recently updated lobby and restaurants and some room renovations as well although they could have done better with the rooms as it appears they went cheap on the flooring in the bedroom half of the room also mini bar was non existent would have thought a room at this price point would have at least had a couple bottles of water for guest.
Some of the mechanics need updating.

Overpriced and poor customer service. Front desk staff and manager very rude and dismissive. Staff said room type was not indicated on my reservation with hotelscom and they just give a standard of what ’s available. I had an email showing room type and they would not even look at it and just swiped my card and handed me a key no apology or accommodation for the inconvenience. Then when hotelscom called and spoke with manager the front desk said it was their policy to provide whatever room type they wanted and admitted they had the room type in the reservation so they lied to me when checking in. Then the room was dirty hairs in shower and sink areas sticky floors toilet not secured to floor updates were cheaply done and tv did n’t work. Also barely one towel in room got an icecream from pantry which was freezer burned and they did n’t care when I showed them and did n’t return money. Valet returned car with radio blasting and was not handed over that way. Just overall poor customer service and would never stay again. overpriced motel standards.

It ’s a historic property but does appear to need a refresh. For example the shower tub enclosure appears to need to be re tiled and in need of more modern look. There was n’t anything unique about the room which was disappointing.

Not bad. I stayed at the Cincinatian Hotel for a business trip. It is in a great location with great restaurants nearby. I work for CHMC so I was able to hop on the CHMC Shuttle a block away. The rooms were okay. They have updated furnishing but they have not really kept up the walls and moldings well. So it feels a bit disconnected. The walls are THIN. I was able to hear people talking and opening and close their doors. The AC unit was also really loud. But the bed was comfy and the TVs are quite large at least in the King romI also used the gym which was not bad. Great new machines and they have bottled water and towels for you. I am still not sure if I would stay at this hotel again.
